title: HUS KLAZOMENAIOS
content:
THE HUS KLAZOMENAIOS (Clazomenean Sow) was a giant winged boar which terrorized the Greek town of Klazomenai
        (Clazomenae) in Ionia, Asia Minor.

Aelian, On Animals 12. 38 (trans. Scholfield) (Greek natural history C2nd A.D.)
          :
        "I have heard that on Klazomenai (Clazomenae) [an island west of Smyrna] there was a sow with wings, and it
        ravaged the territory of Klazomenai. And Artemon records this in his Annals of Klazomenai. That is why
        there is a spot named and celebrated as ‘The Place of the Winged Sow,’ and it is famous. But if
        anyone regards this as myth, let him do so."
